results.title: Man Paralyzed 12 Years Ago Becomes Italy’s First Assisted Suicide
results.abstract: The man, Federico Carboni, overcame a series of legal and bureaucratic challenges before ending his life.

media.caption: On Thursday, Federico Carboni ended his life, becoming Italy’s first legal assisted suicide. Left, Marco Cappato, treasurer of the Luca Coscioni Association, a right-to-die advocacy group, spoke at a rally

results.adx_keywords: Private Spaceflight;Labor and Jobs;Musk, Elon;Shotwell, Gwynne;Space Exploration Technologies Corp
results.title: SpaceX Said to Fire Employees Involved in Letter Rebuking Elon Musk
results.abstract: In an email, Gwynne Shotwell, SpaceX’s president, said the letter had made other employees “feel uncomfortable, intimidated and bullied.”

media.caption: A letter sent by some SpaceX employees said the public behavior and tweeting of Elon Musk, above, was “a frequent source of distraction and embarrassment.”

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Rap and Hip-Hop;Content Type: Personal Profile;Documentary Films and Programs;Theroux, Louis (1970- )
results.title: How Louis Theroux Became a ‘Jiggle Jiggle’ Sensation at Age 52
results.abstract: Decades into his career, the British American journalist has an unlikely TikTok hit that could be the song of the summer. “I am not trying to make it as a rapper,” he says.

media.caption: His money doesn’t jiggle jiggle. It folds. The documentary filmmaker (and rapper?) Louis Theroux at his home in London.
media.copyright: Alexander Coggin for The New York Times

results.title: Emma Thompson and the Challenge of Baring All Onscreen at 63
results.abstract: The actress made the choice to disrobe. Still, she says, it was the most difficult thing she’s ever done in her four-decade career.

media.caption: If “you want the iconography of the female body to change,” Emma Thompson said, “then you better be part of the change.”
media.copyright: Charlotte Hadden for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2020;United States Politics and Government;Rumors and Misinformation;Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);Ethics and Official Misconduct;Trump, Donald J;Pence, Mike;House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack;Republican Party
results.title: A Day After a Portrait of Pence in Danger, Trump Attacks Him Again
results.abstract: In a speech, Donald J. Trump was undeterred by the Jan. 6 House committee’s account of how his rioting supporters menaced the vice president, and the panel’s dismantling of many of his election lies.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: In a speech on Friday in Nashville, former President Donald J. Trump continued to attack his former vice president for not blocking the certification of his 2020 defeat, even though doing so would have been illegal.

results.adx_keywords: Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Presidential Election of 2020;United States Politics and Government;Pence, Mike;Jacob, Gregory F (1974- );Short, Marc;Trump, Donald J;House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack
results.byline: By Annie Karni and Maggie Haberman
results.title: For Mike Pence, Jan. 6 Began Like Many Days. It Ended Like No Other.
results.abstract: An angry mob chanting “hang Mike Pence” came within 40 feet of the vice president. He spent nearly five hours in an underground loading dock. And the president called him a “wimp” and worse.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

results.adx_keywords: Abortion;Jews and Judaism;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Roe v Wade (Supreme Court Decision);Florida
results.title: Synagogue Sues Florida, Saying Abortion Restrictions Violate Religious Freedoms
results.abstract: A South Florida congregation said that under Jewish law, abortion “is required if necessary to protect the health, mental or physical well-being” of a pregnant woman.

media.caption: Rabbi Barry Silver of Congregation L’Dor Va-Dor said it is a violation of Jewish law to forbid a woman from having an abortion if she deems it esssential for her physical or mental health.

results.title: Vince McMahon Steps Down as Head of W.W.E. During Misconduct Investigation
results.abstract: Mr. McMahon, the pro wrestling company’s chairman and chief executive, agreed to pay a secret settlement to an employee with whom he was said to have had an affair, The Wall Street Journal reported this week.

media.caption: Vince McMahon in 2018. He will remain involved in W.W.E.’s creative content, the company said.
media.copyright: Jesse Dittmar for The New York Times

results.title: Walking on Hot Coals: A Company Event Goes Wrong
results.abstract: More than two dozen employees of a Swiss company were injured while walking in bare feet over hot coals, an ancient religious tradition that has become popular on corporate retreats.

media.caption: People walking on burning coals as they take part in the ancient tradition of Anastenaria, a fire-walking ritual, in the northern Greek village of Mavrolefke, in 2019.

results.title: Meet the Peecyclers. Their Idea to Help Farmers Is No. 1.
results.abstract: A shortage of chemical fertilizer, worsened by the war in Ukraine, has growers desperate. It just so happens that human urine has the very nutrients that crops need.

media.caption: A funnel for collecting urine in the home of Kate Lucy and Jon Sellers in Brattleboro, Vt.
media.copyright: John Tully for The New York Times

results.byline: By Vimal Patel, Eduardo Medina and Johnny Diaz
results.title: Shooting at Alabama Church Potluck Leaves Three Dead
results.abstract: The gunfire ended after a parishioner subdued a man who opened fire inside an Episcopal church, the police said. Capital murder warrants were issued on Friday for the man, Robert Findlay Smith.

results.title: Herschel Walker Acknowledges Two More Children He Hadn’t Mentioned
results.abstract: Mr. Walker, the Republican nominee for Senate in Georgia, has often criticized absentee fathers. But this week it has emerged that in addition to a son he often talks about, he has three other children.

media.caption: Herschel Walker is running against Senator Raphael Warnock, a Democrat, in one of this year’s most pivotal Senate races.

results.adx_keywords: Black People;Slavery (Historical);Emancipation Proclamation (1863);United States Politics and Government;Juneteenth;Trump, Donald J;Galveston (Tex);Tulsa (Okla)
results.title: Juneteenth: The History of a New Holiday
results.abstract: On June 19, 1865, enslaved African Americans in Texas were told they were free. A century and a half later, people across the U.S. continue to celebrate the day, which is now a federal holiday.

media.caption: Spectators watch a Juneteenth parade in 2021 in Galveston, Texas, where the holiday got its start in the latter half of the 19th century.

results.adx_keywords: Gun Control;Domestic Violence;United States Politics and Government;Senate;Democratic Party;Republican Party
results.byline: By Emily Cochrane and Stephanie Lai
results.title: Gun Talks Snag on Tricky Question: What Counts as a Boyfriend?
results.abstract: Among the sticking points holding up a final agreement on gun legislation is how to define a boyfriend in a provision meant to keep guns away from domestic abusers.

media.caption: Demonstrators gathered in Washington last week in support of gun control. Republicans in the Senate want to limit the reach of a domestic violence provision, while Democrats want to write it broadly.
media.copyright: Al Drago for The New York Times

results.abstract: The two award-winning actors had never worked together before this brooding FX thriller came along. Who knew the journey would become so existential?

results.title: Here are 4 takeaways from Thursday’s Jan. 6 hearing.
